class_notes:
Math 211 and QTM 315 are pre-requisites for this course. It is recommended that you also have some experience with logic and proofs (e.g., Math 250 or similar transfer credit).


The class builds on introductory game theory by applying the solution concepts learned in the introductory course to more complicated games. The course will address many topics, including (but not limited to): bargaining, principal-agent relationships, and signaling games.


This course meets with POLS 514.
course_description: Selected advanced topics in quantitative sciences. Open only to junior and senior majors; others by permission of instructor.
schedule_location: TTh 4pm-5:15pm in Math & Science Center - W307C
